bibl.title: Paying Taxes to the Thesauroi of the Pathyrites in a Century of Rebellion (186-88 BC).
Politics, Administration and Society in the Hellenistic and Roman World. Proceedings of the International Colloquium, Bertinoro 19-24 July 1997

bibl.note: I. Overview. - II. 186-160 (or 178-160): Tax Receipts from the 'Thesauroi of the Pathyrites'. - III. Reforms of 160/159 and 133/132. The Tax Receipts from the Lower and Upper Toparchy of the Pathyrites. - IV. After 160: Tax Receipts for the Memnoneia and Hermonthis (Lower Toparchy). - V. After 160: Tax Receipts for the Upper Toparchy, Arabia and Pathyris. - VI. The Rebellion of 88 BC. - VII. Where did the Inhabitants of Pathyris Pay their Taxes in Kind? - VIII. Conclusion: Granary Receipts Reflect the Grip of the State on the Thebaid. - Pp. 421-436: Appendix. Survey of the Granary Receipts from the Pathyrites.
